page.title: 14THE CHURCH BUILDING.
page.content: Windmill Field has been my home for 131 years. I have been a home for many creatures. Bats, mice and birds have dwelt within my cold grey walls. I have been a meeting place for many people, I protect them when they meet inside me. My garden is a refuge for bodies. Bodies whose spirits left them many years ago. I have witnessed many ordeals. Some of them were sad, like funerals, some were very happy, like weddings and baptisms. When there is a wedding, people ring my bell, as they do on Sunday mornings. I only have one bell in my bell tower, and a rope dangling down into my body. Inside I have a voice. It is the organ. The organist presses down the keys and I sing to the tune of the song.
